page.title: 19AMNESTY, CRANBROOK GROUP
page.content: Sharon, Hartley, is the home of the Chairman of the Cranbrook and District Group of Amnesty International, which includes members from Hawkhurst, Sandhurst, Tenterden and Biddenden. We work for the release of prisoners of conscience, gaoled for their politics, religion or race though they have used no violence. We continue to write to Libyan authorities about such a prisoner, long overdue for release. In actions addressed to particular countries we protest against detention without trial, and torture and murder by security forces, and we seek abolition of the death penalty world- wide. Friends of the Group telegraph governments, appealing for those in imminent danger of torture or death. From the peace of Kent we reach out to people oppressed and suffering in many parts of the world.
